column4: Hi all. I'm trying to recover my bootloader that Ubuntu installed, but i have two harddrives on my computer. How do i know which harddrive the MBR is on?

It's more complicated than that: Before i had two HD's, the Ubuntu one was the first one. That had the bootloader on it. My dad added the Windows disk to my PC, and made it the master drive. So now i'm confused.
check in the bios which one you boot from
is it safe to overwrite that bootloader?
as safe as it is when installing ubuntu
but the bootloader is on the first disk, which is the one dad forbids me to change.
I'll try. I'll be back if it goes wrong :)
it should, or at least mostly should

It doesn't. It doesn't do a thing when i wave my pen over it or click with it. How do i enable it? (I installed the wacom-tools package, but haven't rebooted yet - did a modprobe wacom though, but still no /dev/input/wacom)
If you read my previous message, do you know how to get it to work?
